intro: Peucedanum officinale subsp. stenocarpum, commonly known as narrow-fruited angelica, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Its leaves are deeply lobed and emit a strong, spicy odor when crushed. The fruit is small, dry, and contains two seeds, distinguishing it from other members of the species.
